criterion: Mentions that the two main kinds of fiber are soluble and insoluble, and provides a definition of each.
Indicates the benefits of soluble fiber, including helping control sugar levels, helping control cholesterol, and making those who take it feel more satiated.
Indicates the health benefits of insoluble fiber, including preventing diverticulosis, hemorrhoids, and constipation.
Includes a final section in the answer with the most important conclusions regarding fiber intake, fiber benefits, and what to do if one wants to take fiber supplements.
Invites the user to ask follow-up questions about how to prepare food high in fiber.
Fails to mention the short-term and long-term side effects of low fiber intake.
Fails to list examples of foods that contain soluble or insoluble fiber.
Mentions that fiber supplements can be used if the amount of natural fiber is not enough, without stating that doing so should be consulted with a health professional.
